title.value: Агроэкономическое и энергетическое обоснование выбора сроков сева и норм высева при возделывании пайзы на зерно
Agroeconomic energetic substantiation for the choice of planting dates and seeding rates in the cultivation of Japanese millet for grain

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Isaev, S.V., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the absence of data for the central zone of the republic according to the study of grain yield of Indian barnyard millet (Japanese millet) (Echinochloa frumentacea) collecting protein from 1 hectare and energy performance of planting dates and seeding rates, part of the research problem allow to conclude the feasibility of the best choice of these elements in crop cultivation soil and climatic conditions of the Grodno region of the Republic of Belarus. The highest grain productivity of Japanese millet plants with the optimal index of damp protein yield (accordingly 14,97 and 1,71 hundreds kilograms per hectare) were obtained while the second sowing term with norm 5 million rising seeds per 1 hectare. The cultivation of Japanese millet plants in object to receive the highest energetic effect is preference while these sowing term and norm (meaning of bioenergetical coefficient composed 1,8). Cultivation Indian barnyard millet of Udalaya 2 variety made it possible to obtain yield of dry matter in grain at the level of 8,39-17,12 centner/ 1 hectare, while the average net income for 2008-2011 was 96,18-154,56 USD / ha and profitability 85,2-135,5 % at a cost of 1 centner of grain cultivation 7,64-9,71 USD. Indian barnyard millet grain can be considered low-cost energy since the power consumption of this product was 764,9-976,5 MJ/centner.
